repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Power Transmission and
            Distribution Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for Uruguay - Power Transmission
            and Distribution Project were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            low or negligible, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: an
            investment loan is not the appropriate vehicle to achieve or
            consolidate sector reform. Power sector reform should be
            based on a realistic assessment of the political economy and
            prospects for acceptance of this reform. Tariff adjustments
            reflecting costs of service ensured national power company
            (UTE's) financial viability. Difficulty of establishing
            efficiency incentives in the case of profit-making SOEs.
            Budget restrictions imposed by the Government on UTE
            hampered investment levels. Impact of UTE's procurement
            framework and procedures on project implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Power Transmission and
            Distribution Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Transmission and Distribution
            Project aims to improve the reliability of the electricity
            service at least cost and to promote the sustainability of
            the reforms recently implemented in the power sector by
            helping the National Power Company (UTE) to adapt to the new
            institutional framework. Project objectives include: 1)
            consolidating sector reforms; 2) consolidating UTE's
            institutional improvements; 3) improving power distribution
            reliability; 4) promoting more efficient use of energy; and
            5) improving customer safety. This project will be the first
            part of a staged approach to modernize the Montevideo
            distribution network and it includes: 1) modification of
            500-kV substations; 2) expansion of the 150-kV transmission
            system in Montevideo; 3) first phase of the renovation of
            the Montevideo distribution system including voltage change
            of the medium voltage system and of the low voltage system;
            4) technical assistance; and 5) training.

The Power Transmission and Distribution
            Project aims to improve the reliability of the electricity

repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Montevideo Power Transmission and
            Distribution Project : environmental impact assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
In order for Uruguay to satisfy market
            demand, studies reveal the need for Uruguay to invest in a
            500K V energy transmission system. This is separate from
            system upgrades and/or changes in tension distribution. The
            objective of this Environmental Impact Study of the
            Transmission System's Expansion Plan Project 1994-2000
            is to ensure the accordant performance of the project's
            components, specifically natural and socioeconomic components.
